title: Can't save logon information or create a primary password
content:
On 84.0.2 on OSx.

Firefox will offer to save usernames and passwords, but then does not remember them in the future. Attempting to import existing data from another browser into Lockwise prompts a request to set a primary password first. Attempting to set a primary password (which is currently not set), yields the error message "Unable to change primary password."

title: The 'new tab' page remains in the last container used
content:
I have noticed the following behaviour with the 'new tab' page. I have the 'new tab' page set as homepage. When I "go home", i.e. to the 'new tab' page, from a page that is in a container (e.g. facebook), the 'new tab' page is still in the container.

Is it possible to make the 'new tab' page always be outside a container, like any other page that has no container assigned? Or maybe it is a bug?

title: How do I write to Mozilla for help?
content:
I have a specific problem...Firefox will not load a particular web site which it previously did for years. I have refreshed and reinstalled with no solution.

Here is my story (nightmare)... When I try to launch my credit union, Navy Federal, the following appears on my screen.

Access Denied You don't have permission to access "http://signon.navyfederal.org/siteminderagent/forms/nfcu.fcc" on this server. Reference #18.859ec817.1618087497.20456bf6

I can launch other web sites with Firefox AND i can launch Navy Federal with other browsers. On subsequent attempts to launch Navy FCU, I always get the same Access Denied message, however, the Reference # changes. THANK YOU!!
